file_content.text: Captain! I never thought we'd see you here! Thought you were too good for us small-time crooks in Port Nowhere.
Once you got your hands on Nok Drayen's ship... whoo.
Can I buy you a drink? Get some pointers? I've been waiting for this a long time....
Careful, you're drooling on the rug there, buddy.
You a fan?
Actually, I'm not the only one who's been waiting....
I don't think so.
Well, what about this?
Out of my way. I've got urgent business.
Get lost.
Oh, believe me, so do I.
So... I've been hearing your name for a while now. Almost as long as you've been hearing mine.
Rogun. They call me "the Butcher." You lost a blaster shipment of mine some time back.
And I don't remember ever getting an apology. How about it, Captain, you know how to say "I'm sorry"?
I'm sorry. But Skavak was the man to blame for that, and he's dead.
Let's work this out.
Plenty of blame to go around. I'm generous that way.
I'm s... I'm sor... I am... incredibly good-looking! Nope. Can't.
I don't say "sorry."
Not really threatened by a man who's lost his guns.
I'm not afraid of you.
Oh, I've got plenty more. Mostly in the hands of the loyal gentlemen waiting for you throughout Port Nowhere.
No one steals from me and lives, girl. And don't try to change my mind. You're not my type.
No one steals from me and lives, boy.
And you're not running away this time. My men have your hangar locked down tight.
Sounds like a fun fight.
Wouldn't dream of leaving.
What were the blasters worth? I'll make it up to you.
Can't we work this out?
Too little. Too late. Too bad.
I'll give your men one chance to surrender. After that, it's for keeps.
Back down now.
Are you crazy? There's like a hundred guys in here!
That's right, Butcher. And it's not just the captain. Me and Sparky are here, too.
Back down, little man.
All right. Open season. A hundred thousand credits to the man who brings me that pretty head.
All right. Open season. A hundred thousand credits to the man who brings me his head.
Done deal, boss. Start moving the funds.
